headline: Shapiro talks importance of mental health awareness at Pittsburgh roundtable
sentences:
But I think it starts by making sure you’ve got mental health counselors in every single school.”
New data shows that since it was launched in 2019, it has received more than 80,000 tips from students across the state.
Nearly 73% of the tips focused on bullying, suicide and self harm, mental illness, or discrimination and harassment.
Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro was in Pittsburgh on Wednesday to talk with students about mental health.
The anonymous system was created as a way to mitigate school-based violence and school shootings.
“Mental health, especially amongst our young people, is a crisis,” Shapiro said.
Among the topics was the “Safe-2-Say Something” reporting system.
He held a roundtable discussion at North Hills High School.
There’s a multitude of ways to do that.
